New Records: Mohammed Shami took 7 wickets, a new record for India in a World Cup semi-final
Virat Kohli scored 117 runs, a significant individual achievement
Key Match Events: The dismissal of Kane Williamson and Mitchell Santner by Mohammed Shami proved pivotal
The partnership between Williamson and Mitchell was a high-pressure moment
Shami's seven-wicket haul was a turning point
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma emphasized the need for calm and focused performance
Shami reflected on his bowling strategy and the team's determination
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the team's resilience and the importance of the win
New Zealand's effort was commended but their chase was deemed insufficient
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's chase of 398 was always an uphill task
The match marked India's second consecutive World Cup final appearance
Others: The match was played at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai, a historic venue for India
India's victory set up a final clash against either Australia or South Africa
